captions.text: I bought a lot of good weed
Caught your dog in my hut,
It took chicken from my fridge
As I was frying hot ducks
Where's them boobies? I wanna ice this cake
And I sold the wine to you
Guess I'll shave a beard with glue
Can't be around dogs who fart all the time
Gonna shave that beard with glue.

title: "Beard With Glue" — a Bad Lip Reading

comments.author: youngatnaruto

comments.text:
+youngatnaruto Oh my god, that is AWESOME. With that story behind it, this 
song could hit #1. (It reminds me a bit of "A Whiter Shade of Pale", not 
that many BLR fans would know that song...) When I first heard this song, I 
also thought the lyrics took a dark turn around 2:16-2:26: not only does 
the melody become darker, but the lyrics seem almost apocalyptic to me. 
"Who do you think would win in a bear fight in the night" seems to evoke 
something powerful, disturbing, and uncontrollable, almost like he's saying 
"Judgement Day is coming and we'll all die". Then the especially haunting 
line: "Who's gonna hoard dark water for days?" That sounds like it means 
something like: After the apocalypse, people will be driven crazy by the 
lack of necessities and will be driven to hoarding polluted water to drink. 
That pair of lines sounds very philosophical and Pink-Floydian (look it up 
if you don't know what that means), certainly dark, cryptic, apocalyptic 
Pink Floyd-like sentiments. And then, of course, he collapses our neat 
little house of cards by declaring "Can't be around dogs who fart all the 
time!".

comments.text:
+MilesEdgeworth129
Youtube has given viewers of content the opportunity to type their 
opinions, negative or positive.  It's not a 1st Amendment thing because 
Youtube is a private business but it is a freedom of speech thing in the 
context of said private business.  See?  That means you, I, anyone can type 
whatever the fuck they want regardless of how you, or anyone else, feel 
about it.  If you don't like what you read you can A) ignore it and watch 
the fucking video, B) reply with something other than: "hey, I'm a total 
butthole, don't type something mean about the video," C) ignore the comment 
and the video and go outside.

comments.author: sergiooconormeyer

comments.text:
OK, I'll attempt an analysis of the lyrics (though I know they're not meant 
to make sense). He is angry and upset after breaking up with his impulsive 
over-eating (burger + fries), over-drinking (sold the wine) girlfriend. She 
is in a bad paranoid state from the excesses (bullfrog hates you) and is 
losing all her friends (drowning in blood). She is the 'psychotic dog'. 
However this relationship is all he had and he is helpless without her and 
doesn't know what to do with himself (guess I'll shave...). This helpless 
confused state is exemplified in the first verse.﻿

comments.text:
+Robert Strilic It's not a parody. You just don't get it. It's called "bad 
lip-reading". Imagine there was no sound, and you have to guess what the 
guy is singing just from reading his lips. It has nothing to do with the 
original song, it's just a talent to fit words to the movements of the 
lips. This creates really funny, nonsensical sentences.
